newsitem.title: USA: Harris Speciality Chemicals seeks buyer for PCR.
newsitem.headline: Harris Speciality Chemicals seeks buyer for PCR.

text.p: Privately-held construction and specialty chemicals company Harris Speciality Chemicals said on Tuesday it was seeking a buyer for its PCR Inc subsidiary, which makes silicon and fluorine-based chemicals.
The Florida-based unit has annual revenues of about $50 million and 189 employees, the company said in a statement.
Proceeds from the sale would be used to reduce long-term debt, Harris said. The sale would allow Harris to focus on its core construction business, it said.
"Since HSC was established in early 1994, PCR has experienced terrific growth - more than 50 percent in three years," Chairman D. George Harris said.
Two units of PCR, Hydrozo and Jeene, which make silane sealers and structural expansion joints for the construction industry, would remain with HSC, it said.
